review: You know, it's much better than I thought it would be.  I already had a Chromecast with the intention of using that for my streaming video, but that device was only ok.  I had used the Amazon app that comes with the Samsung SmartTV and that was also only ok as it was often choppy, wouldn't connect, etc. so I pretty much expected that the Fire TV would be like that app.  Boy, was I wrong!  When it arrived, I left it in the box for about a week because I didn't feel like configuring it.  Knowing that it didn't support bluetooth keyboards, I just didn't look forward to "typing" my information using the remote.  However, I was shocked to find that the device comes configured -- I just plug it in, set up the wifi, and it already knows who I am.  At that point, I started to search for something to watch and rather than type things in, the Fire TV pushes you towards using the voice interface.  My expectations were not high, but it works really, really well!  It's too bad the YouTube app doesn't support the voice feature as well, but oh well.  Maybe my experiences with Samsung and Google Chromecast set the bar pretty low, but I'm ridiculously happy with my Fire TV.
